intro: Microsteris californica, commonly known as the California microsteris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are white or pale yellow. Microsteris californica is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to thrive in mild, Mediterranean climates.
